page.title: 10Home Life in Chalton
page.content: Two households interviewed had no pets. Cats were the most popular, followed by dogs. Most widely used shopping area; Petersfield although Waitrose at Cowplain also popular.Most families did main shopping weekly. Of amenities required in a hamlet, all mentioned a freezer and a phone, but overwhelmingly, the need for more than one car. We asked the Middle School children how they spent a Sunday:Average rising time was 7.30am: nobody had a cooked breakfast. Sunday morning activities: walking the dog, playing in a den and riding bicycles.All had a light midday meal, a cooked evening dinner. Sunday afternoons were spent helping gardening, playing or on a computer. All read in bed and were asleep by 9pm.
